hero.title: Evaluate your attention with stimuli

clearResults.title: Clear results

multiDevice.title: Multi-device

scientificValidation.title: Scientific Foundation
scientificValidation.description: Our evaluations are backed by scientifically validated methodologies to accurately measure cognitive abilities.

sart.name: SART Task
sart.description: Measures the ability to maintain sustained attentional focus and detect attention lapses in real time, evaluating consistency in stimulus response.

stroopFlanker.name: Stroop and Flanker
stroopFlanker.description: Evaluate inhibitory control and the ability to resist interference from distracting stimuli, measuring reaction time to cognitive conflicts.

nBack.name: N-Back Task
nBack.description: Analyzes working memory, information retention and the ability to update attentional focus under different cognitive loads.

pvt.name: PVT Task
pvt.description: Records reaction times and variability in attentional processing, being a sensitive indicator of mental fatigue.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about CognitiveTrace

whatIs.question: What is CognitiveTrace?
whatIs.answer: CognitiveTrace is a cognitive assessment tool that uses stimulus-response tasks to measure aspects of attention such as focus, consistency, and responsiveness. It is based on scientifically validated methodologies.

howLong.question: How long does it take to complete the test?
howLong.answer: The complete test takes approximately 5-10 minutes. It includes several short tasks designed to evaluate different aspects of your attention without causing fatigue.

needRegistration.question: Do I need to register to use CognitiveTrace?
needRegistration.answer: No, you don't need to register. You can start the test immediately from your browser. Results are shown at the end of each session.

accuracy.question: How accurate are the results?
accuracy.answer: The results are based on scientifically validated methodologies such as SART, Stroop, Flanker, N-Back, and PVT. However, for clinical diagnoses always consult with a healthcare professional.

dataPrivacy.question: What happens to my data?
dataPrivacy.answer: Your assessment data is processed locally on your device when possible. We do not store personally identifiable information without your explicit consent.

preparation.question: How do I prepare for the test?
preparation.answer: Find a quiet place, make sure you have sound available, and dedicate a few minutes without interruptions. No special prior preparation is needed.

retake.question: Can I retake the test?
retake.answer: Yes, you can retake the test as many times as you want. However, we recommend waiting at least a few hours between sessions for more representative results.
